automata

Class LTL2RabinLibrary

  • java.lang.Object
    • automata.LTL2RabinLibrary

  • public class LTL2RabinLibrary
extends java.lang.Object
    LTL-to-DRA conversion via
    1. hard-coded DRA for special formulas
    2. direct translation into DRA for simple path formulas with temporal bounds

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) static class  LTL2RabinLibrary.OperandInfo
      Helper class for storing info about an operand of a simple Until formula: Can be either TRUE, FALSE, a label or a negated label

      static DA<java.util.BitSet,? extends AcceptanceOmega> getDAforLTL(Expression ltl, Values constants, AcceptanceType... allowedAcceptance)
      Attempts to convert an LTL formula into a deterministic omega-automaton (with one of the allowed acceptance conditions) by direct translation methods of the library: Relies on getDRAForLTL, with appropriate pre/post-processing for acceptance types that are not Rabin.
      static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> getDRAforLTL(Expression ltl, Values constants)
      Attempts to convert an LTL formula into a DRA by direct translation methods of the library: First, look up hard-coded DRA from the DRA map. Second, if the formula is a simple path formula with temporal bounds, use the special constructions constructDRAFor.... Return null if the automaton can not be constructed using the library.
      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

    • Constructor Detail

    • Method Detail

      • getDAforLTL

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,? extends AcceptanceOmega> getDAforLTL(Expression ltl,
                                                                         Values constants,
                                                                         AcceptanceType... allowedAcceptance)
                                                                  throws PrismException
        Attempts to convert an LTL formula into a deterministic omega-automaton (with one of the allowed acceptance conditions) by direct translation methods of the library: Relies on getDRAForLTL, with appropriate pre/post-processing for acceptance types that are not Rabin. Return null if the automaton can not be constructed using the library.
        The LTL formula is represented as a PRISM Expression, in which atomic propositions are represented by ExpressionLabel objects.
        Parameters:
        ltl - the LTL formula
        constants - values for constants in the formula (may be null)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • getDRAforLTL

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> getDRAforLTL(Expression ltl,
                                                                Values constants)
                                                         throws PrismException
        Attempts to convert an LTL formula into a DRA by direct translation methods of the library:
        • First, look up hard-coded DRA from the DRA map.
        • Second, if the formula is a simple path formula with temporal bounds, use the special constructions constructDRAFor....
        Return null if the automaton can not be constructed using the library.
        The LTL formula is represented as a PRISM Expression, in which atomic propositions are represented by ExpressionLabel objects.
        Parameters:
        ltl - the LTL formula
        constants - values for constants in the formula (may be null)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructDRAForSimpleUntilFormula

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> constructDRAForSimpleUntilFormula(ExpressionTemporal expr,
                                                                                     Values constants,
                                                                                     boolean negated)
                                                                              throws PrismException
        Construct a prism.DA<BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> for the given until formula. The expression is expected to have the form A U B, where A and B are either ExpressionLabels or true/false, both possibly negated. The operator can have integer bounds.
        Parameters:
        expr - the until formula
        constants - values for constants (in bounds)
        negated - create DRA for the complement, i.e., !(A U B)
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructDRAForUntil

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> constructDRAForUntil(java.lang.String labelA,
                                                                        boolean aNegated,
                                                                        java.lang.String labelB,
                                                                        boolean bNegated,
                                                                        IntegerBound bounds)
        Construct a DRA for A U_bounds B. Can be complemented by switching the acceptance sets.
        Parameters:
        labelA - the label of A
        aNegated - is A negated?
        labelB - the label of B
        bNegated - is B negated?

      • constructDRAForFinally

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> constructDRAForFinally(java.lang.String labelA,
                                                                          boolean negateA,
                                                                          IntegerBound bounds)
        Construct a DRA for LTL formula "F_bounds a". If negateA == true, constructs DRA for "F_bounds !a". Can be complemented by switching the acceptance sets.

      • constructDRAForTrue

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> constructDRAForTrue(java.lang.String label)
                                                                throws PrismException
        Construct a DRA that always accepts. If label == null, then there is no label, if label != null then there is a single label in the set of atomic propositions. Can be complemented by switching the acceptance sets.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • constructDRAForInitialStateLabel

        public static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> constructDRAForInitialStateLabel(java.lang.String label,
                                                                                    boolean negatedLabel)
                                                                             throws PrismException
        Construct a DRA that accepts if the first label corresponds to the provided label. If negatedLabel == true then automaton accepts if the word starts with the negated label. Can be complemented by switching the acceptance sets.
        Throws:
        PrismException

      • createDRAFromString

        private static DA<java.util.BitSet,AcceptanceRabin> createDRAFromString(java.lang.String s,
                                                                        java.util.List<java.lang.String> labels)
                                                                 throws PrismException
        Create a DRA from a string, e.g.: "2 states (start 0), 1 labels: 0-{0}->1 0-{}->0 1-{0}->1 1-{}->0; 1 acceptance pairs: ({},{1})"
        Throws:
        PrismException

        private static java.util.BitSet createBitSetFromString(java.lang.String s)
                                                throws PrismException
        Create a BitSet from a string, e.g. "0,3,4".
        Throws:
        PrismException

        Throws:
